newsitem.title: MEXICO: FORECAST - Serfin Q3 results seen weak.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Serfin Q3 results seen weak.

text.p: Mexico's Grupo Financiero Serfin will likely turn in poor third-quarter results even though its fundamentals are slowly improving and it has moved to clean up its balance sheet, analysts said on Friday.

Analysts said Serfin may report a further loss for the third quarter after posting a loss of 2.655 billion pesos in the second quarter, when it aggressively created reserves to cover 100 percent of past-due loans.
Carlos Gomez, a bank analyst at Paribas in New York, said he expected Serfin to turn in a third-quarter loss of 200 million pesos.

While the bank's management has worked to recapitalize the balance sheet and increase core deposits, Serfin's recovery from Mexico's banking crisis will not come quickly, Gomez said. Serfin was the country's first major bank to tap the government's Fobaproa bank-protection fund.
Serfin still needs about $500 million in recapitalization, according to Gomez.
Analysts also said that the bank's $290 million convertible debt deal with J.P. Morgan, while the investment bank finds a minority partner for Serfin, means an eventual dilution of B shares.
